info.title: LanguageTool API
info.description: Check texts for style and grammar issues with LanguageTool. See our wiki for access limitations.

post.description:
The main feature - check a text with LanguageTool for possible
style and grammar issues.

text.description: The text to be checked. This parameter is required.

language.description: A language code like `en-US`, `de-DE`, `fr`, or `auto` to guess the language automatically (see `preferredVariants` below). For languages with variants (English, German, Portuguese) spell checking will only be activated when you specify the variant, e.g. `en-GB` instead of just `en`.

altLanguages.description: EXPERIMENTAL: Comma-separated list of alternative language codes to check for dissimilarity with the main language. Unknown words similar to a word from the main language are considered errors with type 'Hint'. For languages with variants (e.g., English, German, Portuguese), specify the variant (e.g., 'en-GB' for British English instead of just 'en').

motherTongue.description: A language code representing the user's native language. This enables false friends checks for certain language pairs.

preferredVariants.description: Comma-separated list of preferred language variants. The language detector used with `language=auto` can detect e.g. English, but it cannot decide whether British English or American English is used. Thus this parameter can be used to specify the preferred variants like `en-GB` and `de-AT`. Only available with `language=auto`.

enabledRules.description: IDs of rules to be enabled, comma-separated

disabledRules.description: IDs of rules to be disabled, comma-separated

enabledCategories.description: IDs of categories to be enabled, comma-separated. Each ID corresponds to a specific category.

disabledCategories.description: IDs of categories to be disabled, comma-separated

enabledOnly.description: Specifies whether only the rules and categories whose IDs are specified with `enabledRules` or `enabledCategories` are enabled.

200.description: the result of checking the text

get.summary: Get a list of supported languages.
